column4: Quick question: how can I forge apt-get (or some similar util) to allow to to install libapache2-mod-php4 when libapache2-mod-php5 is already installed?
simple answer: do not do it
use aptitude and tell it that you want to keep php5
yeah, the third column has a A for automatic (also automatic removals) and M (for manual)
I'll make it.  I'm not a fan, but not a zealot.

aptitude shows them all... well, i like it... ;-)
yeah, install php{4,5} and switch between mod-php{4,5}... but i guess you want to do that anyway :)
choose _either_ synaptic or aptitude, they do not like each other
the trick is to correct everything, so that aptitude will not install or deinstall anything when you press "g"

well, i have never used synaptic extensively, so i do not really know what aptitude wants to change..... best, you fire up aptitude, press g once.... you will have categories like "will be removed".... go to the heading (starting with --) and press "+" for install (do not deinstall)...
do the same with things to install, press "-" to inhibit installation
